intro: Adelaster albovenosus, commonly known as the white-flowered star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Adelaster albovenosus is native to regions in Europe and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
